item.description:
We return to our "summer" rotation with the May meeting by getting together at one of our members' homes.

This month we meet at the home of Mercedes Foster-Dougherty in Windham (about 25 minutes from Portland). Learn about how we approach a property from a permaculture perspective and see all the exciting things Mercedes already has going on, like: chickens, several gardens, fruit trees, worm composting, earth oven (in progress), baby ducks!!!, and more... Open to all experience levels.

*Note - please bring seeds and/or plant materials to swap if you're so inclined*

House meetings typically go like this:

  • Meet at 6:30 and start a tour of our member's home while we have daylight (try to arrive by or before 6:30 if you can so you don't miss anything our host has to tell us or miss questions from other members...)
  • During the tour we hear about site "assets" and "challenges" and ask questions
  • About 7:15 or 7:30 we have a potluck supper, general conversation and then a bit of an agenda such as..
  • Roundtable - introductions and thoughts about the property we viewed
  • A summary of our best ideas for the member to use as they see fit
  • A few house keeping items, like upcoming events, etc.
  • Break up between 8:30 and 9:00


CARPOOL: We DO need some people to carpool in order to accomodate 20 people. Meet at 5:50pm for a 6:00 departure from the Marginal Way Park-and-Ride (Across from Bally Fitness). I will start a carpool thread on the message board for this meeting. If you plan to carpool, either post or contact someone directly so we know your intentions. Also exchange mobile phone numbers with your carpool buddies if possible. Carpool thread: http://www.meetup.com...

Potluck Breakdown:
Last Name A-G Main Dish
Last Name H-M Bread or Beverage
Last Name N-T Side Dish or Salad
Last Name U-Z Desert or Appetizer


Please see our Meetup Event RSVP Guidelines:
http://permaculture.m...

Please remember to bring your own potluck kit (plate/bowl/utensils/cup/napkin)! Please consider bringing your digital camera and posting up a few photos after the event!
Potluck food safety ideas here:
http://fycs.ifas.ufl....

group.name: Portland Maine Permaculture & The Resilience Hub

item.name: May Permaculture Meetup in Windham, Maine
